en.variables_appSettingsHelp: The name of the app setting containing your storage account connection string.
en.variables_selectConnection: Click select to choose a connection
en.TimerTrigger_description: A function that will be run on a specified schedule
en.timerTrigger_schedule_help: Enter a cron expression of the format '{second} {minute} {hour} {day} {month} {day of week}' to specify the schedule.
en.timerTrigger_schedule_errorText: Invalid Cron Expression. Please consult https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-bindings-timer#cron-expressions to learn more.
en.QueueTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specified Azure Storage queue
en.queueTrigger_queueName_help: Name of the queue from which the message will be read
en.queueTrigger_queueName_errorText: Queue name must start and end with a letter or number, and it can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and the hyphen. The name must be 3 to 63 characters.
en.BlobTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a blob is added to a specified container
en.blobTrigger_path_help: The path within your storage account that the trigger will monitor.
en.blobTrigger_path_errorText: Your blob path must be a container name of 3 to 63 characters, followed by a blob name of 1 to 1,024 characters. The blob name can be any combination of characters and can contain a maximum of 254 path segments, which are separated by the forward slash (/).
en.HttpTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever it receives an HTTP request, responding based on data in the body or query string
en.httpTrigger_authLevel_help: Authorization level controls whether the function requires an API key and which key to use; Function uses a function key; Admin uses your master key. The function and master keys are found in the 'keys' management panel on the portal, when your function is selected. For user-based authentication, go to Function App Settings.
en.ServiceBusQueueTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specficied Service Bus queue
en.serviceBusTrigger_connection_help: The name of the app setting containing your Service Bus connection string. The connection string must have Listen rights.
en.serviceBusTrigger_queueName_help: The queue from which the message will be read.
en.serviceBusTrigger_queueName_errorText: Queue name must start and end with a letter or number, and it can contain only letters, numbers, the hyphen, the period, and the underscore. The name must be 1 to 50 characters.
en.ServiceBusTopicTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to the specified Service Bus Topic
en.serviceBusTrigger_topicName_help: The name of the topic from which the message will be read.
en.serviceBusTrigger_topicName_errorText: Topic name must start and end with a letter or number, and it can contain only letters, numbers, the hyphen, the period, and the underscore. The name must be 1 to 50 characters.
en.serviceBusTrigger_subscriptionName_help: Subscription name within the topic to bind to.
en.serviceBusTrigger_subscriptionName_error: Subscription name must start and end with a letter or number, and it can contain only letters, numbers, the hyphen, the period, and the underscore. The name must be 1 to 50 characters.
en.EventGridTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever an event grid receives a new event
en.EventHubTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever an event hub receives a new event
en.eventHubTrigger_connection_help: The name of the app setting containing your Event Hub connection string. The connection string must have Receive permissions.
en.eventHubTrigger_path_help: The name of the event hub from which to trigger
en.eventHubTrigger_path_errorText: The event hub name must start and end with a letter or number, and it can contain only letters, numbers, the hyphen, the period, and the underscore. The name must be 1 to 50 characters.
en.eventHubTrigger_consumerGroup_help: Event Hub consumer group from which to receive events
en.eventHubTrigger_consumerGroup_errorText: The consumer group must start and end with a letter or number, and it can contain only letters, numbers, the hyphen, the period, and the underscore. The $Default group is also allowed. The name must be 1 to 50 characters.
en.CosmosDBTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever documents change in a document collection
en.cosmosDBIn_connection_help: The name of the App Setting containing the connection string to the service that contains the collection to be monitored.
en.cosmosDBIn_databaseName_help: Name of the Cosmos DB database that includes the collection to be monitored.
en.cosmosDBIn_collectionName_help: Name of the collection to be monitored.
en.cosmosDBIn_leaseCollectionName_help: Name of the collection to store the leases.
en.cosmosDBIn_createIfNotExists_label: Create lease collection if it does not exist
en.cosmosDBIn_createIfNotExists_help: Checks for existence and automatically creates the leases collection.
en.RabbitMQTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specified RabbitMQ queue
en.rabbitMqIn_connectionStringSetting_help: The name of the app setting containing your RabbitMQ connection.
en.KafkaTrigger_description: A function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specified Kafka
en.kafka_name_help: Name used to identify trigger in code
en.kafka_name_errorText: The kafka name must start with a letter, and it can contain only letters and numbers. The name must be 1 to 127 characters.
en.kafka_brokerlist_help: The name of the app setting containing your brokers list
en.kafka_topic_help: Name of the topic to receive kafka messages from
en.kafka_username_help: SASL username for use with the PLAIN and SASL_SCRAM
en.kafka_password_label: SASL password for use with the PLAIN and SASL_SCRAM
en.kafka_password_help: The name of the app setting containing your SASL password
en.kafka_protocol_help: Security protocol used to communicate with brokers
en.kafka_authenticationmode_help: SASL mechanism to use for authentication
en.DurableFunctionsOrchestrator_description: An orchestrator function that invokes activity functions in a sequence.
en.cosmosDBIn_containerName_help: Name of the container to be monitored.
en.cosmosDBIn_leaseContainerName_help: Name of the container to store the leases.
en.cosmosDBIn_createLeaseContainerIfNotExis: Create lease container if it does not exist
Checks for existence and automatically creates the leases container.
en.SqlTrigger_description: A function that takes a SQL table to monitor for changes and invokes the function with updated rows.
en.sql_trigger_table_help: This is the table that is monitored for changes by the trigger.
en.sql_trigger_connection_help: The name of the app setting containing your SQL connection string.
en.SqlInputBinding_description: A function that takes a SQL query to run on a provided table or view and returns the output of the query
en.sql_input_object_help: This is the table or view name for the SQL input binding.
en.sql_input_connection_help: The name of the app setting containing your SQL connection string.
en.SqlOutputBinding_description: A function that takes a list of rows and upserts them into the user table
en.sql_output_table_help: This is the table for the SQL output binding.
en.sql_output_connection_help: The name of the app setting containing your SQL connection string.
en.daprPublishOutput_description: Dapr publish output binding enables you to publish messages to external messaging systems (such as message queues, event hubs, or other event-driven systems) as part of your application's workflow.
en.daprServiceInvocationTrigger_description: Using Dapr Service Invocation Trigger, your azure functions can reliably and securely communicate with other applications using the standard HTTP protocol.
en.daprTopicTrigger_description: Using Dapr Topic Trigger, your azure functions can react to a message published on a Topic mentioned in your function.
en.assistantSkillTrigger_name_help: Name used to identify trigger in code
en.assistantSkillTrigger_functionName_help: The name of the function to be invoked by the assistant.
en.assistantSkillTrigger_functionDescriptio: The description of the assistant function, which is provided to the LLM.
en.assistantSkillTrigger_parameterDescripti: The JSON description of the function parameter, which is provided to the LLM. If no description is provided, the description will be autogenerated.
en.assistantSkillTrigger_model_help: The OpenAI chat model to use. When using Azure OpenAI, this should be the name of the model deployment.
en.assistantCreate_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.assistantQuery_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.assistantQuery_id_help: The ID of the Assistant to query.
en.assistantQuery_timestampUtc_help: The timestamp of the earliest message in the chat history to fetch.
en.assistantPost_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.assistantPost_id_help: The ID of the Assistant to query.
en.assistantPost_model_help: The OpenAI chat model to use. When using Azure OpenAI, this should be the name of the model deployment.
en.assistantPost_userMessage_help: The user message that user has entered for assistant to respond to.
en.embeddingsInput_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.embeddingsInput_model_help: The ID of the model to use for embeddings.
en.embeddingsInput_maxChunkLength_help: The maximum number of characters to chunk the input into.
en.embeddingsInput_maxOverlap_help: The maximum number of characters to overlap between chunks.
en.embeddingsInput_input_help: The input string to generate embeddings for.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_model_help: The ID of the model to use for embeddings.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_maxChunkLength_hel: The maximum number of characters to chunk the input into.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_maxOverlap_help: The maximum number of characters to overlap between chunks.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_input_help: The input string to generate embeddings for.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_connectionName_hel: The name of an app setting or environment variable which contains a connection string value.
en.embeddingsStoreOutput_collection_help: The name of the collection or table to search.
en.semanticSearch_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.semanticSearch_connectionName_help: The name of an app setting or environment variable which contains a connection string value.
en.semanticSearch_collection_help: The name of the collection or table to search.
en.semanticSearch_query_help: The semantic query text to use for searching.
en.semanticSearch_embeddingsModel_help: The model to use for embeddings.
en.semanticSearch_chatModel_help: The name of the Large Language Model to invoke for chat responses.
en.semanticSearch_systemPrompt_help: The system prompt to use for prompting the large language model.
en.semanticSearch_maxKnowledgeLength_help: The number of knowledge items to inject into the systemPrompt.
en.textCompletion_name_help: The variable name used in function.json.
en.textCompletion_prompt_help: The prompt to generate completions for, encoded as a string.
en.textCompletion_model_help: The ID of the model to use.
en.textCompletion_temperature_help: The sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2.
en.textCompletion_topP_help: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling.
en.textCompletion_maxTokens_help: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.
